intro: Olinia emarginata, commonly known as the African wild bean, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, with pinnate leaves and yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated pods and are often used in traditional medicine. Olinia emarginata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for livestock in its native habitat.
